message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $200.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $80. I'm willing to pay that price for it.

I understand you're looking for a good deal, but I'm afraid I need to make a profit on this sale. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I can offer it to you for $160. It's a fair price considering the product's value and what similar items are selling for.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $120 for the product. It's a fair price considering the value you mentioned, and I'm willing to compromise to get the deal done.

I can see you're really interested in the product, and I appreciate your willingness to compromise. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $120. I can offer it to you for $180, which is a good compromise between our initial offer and your counteroffer. This is my final offer, so I hope we can come to an agreement.

I understand this is your final offer, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you at $150, which is the highest I'm willing to go. If you're willing to accept this price, I'll take the product.
